page.title: 04Education in Sandwich
page.content: Sandwich has two Secondary Schools one Junior School,one Infant's School and a Nursery School. Nursery School was in the Church Hall but is now run by volunteers in its own building.Ages 2-5 years. Infant School is in an old building with small garden and playground around.Ages 5-7 years. Junior School building is 15 years old and used to have a swimming pool. Many activities are run for 7-11 years. The larger secondary school is the Secondary Modern which takes pupils from the villages of Worth,Ham,Ash and Eastry.11-16 year olds work here,of all abilities and take CSE and 'O' exams. Sir Roger Manwood's School is a selective Grammar School with boarding facilities.Pupils take 'O','A',and University entry examinations.
